p: Pretreatment with the immunomodulatory polysaccharide constituents of A. bidentata inhibited the proliferation of malaria parasite through immunostimulant mechanism. It was shown to strongly enhance the Th1 immune responses in body against the malarial parasites ( 129). Its combination with cubosome polysaccharides is found to be effective in promoting lymphocyte augmentation and in triggering the transformation of T-lymphocytes into T h-cells ( 130). Saponins from the plant have potential cellular and humoral immune responses with slight hemolytic and specific antibody enhancement ( 131, 132).
